subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}}: {{Han compound|每|㐬|liushu=p}} – a woman giving birth. A woman 每 squatting on left, with child head down on right 㐬. The top part of 㐬 is {{l|zh|子}} inverted, an abstracted body with a head at the bottom; compare [[充]].  The lines (川) below head are amniotic fluid coming out.

A later alternative form is {{l|zh|育}}.

Alternately considered a {{Han compound|每|𠫓|川|ls=psc|ls2=ic|c1=s|c2=p|c3=s|t1=woman|t2=child|t3=amniotic fluid}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
